node.text:
From a very early age, African-American civil rights icon and #UnitedNations leader, Ralph Bunche understood the pain and peril of racism.

Yet Bunche turned those experiences into a catalyst for change on the international stage, pursuing a legendary career as one of the most senior diplomatic officials of his time. 

From walking side-by-side with Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., to working for peace as a UN mediator in Palestine, watch and learn more about the Nobel Prize Laureate. 

#FightRacism

node.title: Hero for Justice on the World's Stage

node.text:
"Because of climate change we are seeing even more intense storms, rising sea levels and many deaths. But we don’t have to accept this – we can act - and we must act as a matter of justice."

Environmentalist Sunita Narain explains why it's important that all of us #ActNow to achieve the goals of the #ParisAgreement. 

"Every country, rich or poor, is exposed to extreme weather. We need to build better and more resilient infrastructure – from electricity grids to roads, bridges and buildings. All these approaches are set out in the Paris Climate Agreement – adopted by nearly 200 countries. We can do it – we must do it – and we must act quickly."

From recycling to using less energy and water to opting for public transport, each and every one of us can take little steps in our everyday lives that can have a big impact. Tell us in the comments what you are doing to protect our planet.

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.text:
"We don’t have to choose between using energy and protecting the planet."

@unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains the role sustainable energy plays in building a better future for all. 
 
"Imagine a world where every job is based on clean, renewable energy – and where wind and solar are even more abundant. And where energy is affordable and reliable – and available to everyone. This might sound like a fantasy – but it’s achievable and we know how to get there."

The #ParisAgreement on the climate emergency is our roadmap for moving to a low-carbon economy and achieving a sustainable future. Since this international #ClimateAction treaty opened for signature 5 years ago, almost 200 countries have signed on to tackle the climate crisis together to limit global warming to protect people and planet.

 #GlobalGoals #ActNow

node.text:
Cities are major contributors to the climate crisis, but also an important hub for #ClimateAction.

@UNEP Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains what a green future for cities could look like & how the #ParisAgreement can help us get there.

node.text: Meet @unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee. She's a Kenyan engineer taking #ClimateAction and helping to #BeatPlasticPollution by recycling plastic waste into building materials.

node.text:
"My warmest wishes to everyone celebrating #EidAlFitr," #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres said on Wednesday.

"I was delighted to mark the end of Ramadan with Asia El-Sayeed Ali, a Yemeni health worker helping malnourished children and mothers in a @worldfoodprogramme-supported nutrition clinic.

Asia personifies core values of Ramadan: compassion and empathy. Her resilience in the face of the devastating conflict in Yemen, as well as her life-saving work in support of people in desperate need have moved me greatly.

As #Ramadan comes to an end, let us continue drawing inspiration from its many lessons of solidarity that are celebrated during this Holy Month."

Regram: @antonioguterres

node.text:
Regram: @antonioguterres

Young people are the most affected by the climate decisions taken today. Their ideas, voices and actions are crucial to deliver meaningful and ambitious #ClimateAction for all.

@pcopaloma and @mahery_loha are two inspiring climate activists who exemplify the leadership and commitment of young people worldwide to address the most challenging problems we face today.

I'm grateful for our discussion and their insights on how to achieve the meaningful participation of youth, women and indigenous peoples as we tackle the climate crisis.

#ActNow #GlobalGoals

node.text:
@unep Goodwill Ambassador @aidanrgallagher describes how the #ParisAgreement can help us create a world free from the threats of the climate crisis. 

"This is personal for me," he explains. "I don’t want to choke on the air I breathe, or see wildfires burning out of control. So let’s keep working together. And you too can protect what is left and repair what has been damaged."

On Thursday's #EarthDay, @antonioguterres will be joining the U.S. Leaders’ Summit on Climate to reiterate his call for urgent #ClimateAction. 

"The Paris Agreement is our pact with our children, grandchildren & the whole human family," said the Secretary-General. 

"The climate crisis is the race of our lifetimes. We must go much further, and much faster."

#GenerationRestoration #ForNature

node.text: On Monday's International Day of Human Space Flight, @europeanspaceagency astronaut @thom_astro became the newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador. He will use his voice and unique perspective from space to advocate for #ClimateAction and to help reduce hunger.

node.title: French astronaut Thomas Pesquet becomes newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador

node.text:
All children have the right to a happy and healthy childhood, free from discrimination and full of love and acceptance. And acceptance begins at home. Every child should grow up in safe, loving and nurturing environment.

No child should suffer because of who they are. All children deserve protection and equal rights. Let's see kids the way they see themselves.

On Wednesday's International Transgender Day of Visibility, join @unaidsglobal in calling for the rights of transgender children to be protected.

#TransDayOfVisibility #SeeMeAsIAm

node.text:
Six years since the start of the conflict, millions of Yemenis are in need of humanitarian assistance. Over four million are displaced within the country. 

Our colleagues from UNHCR, the #UnitedNations Refugees Agency, are in #Yemen providing aid, but they cannot do it alone. 

Please click the link in the @refugees' bio to help. 

#YemenCantWait

node.text:
Maya (@ghazalmia) fled Damascus, #Syria at age 16 and overcame numerous barriers to become the world’s first female Syrian refugee pilot. 

Check out her inspiring story!

#WithRefugees

node.title: Meet Maya Ghazal, the newest @refugees Goodwill Ambassador

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 14, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people sitting, people standing and indoor.

node.text:
Ingrid Macdonald (centre), UN Resident Coordinator in Bosnia and Herzegovina, and a colleague working for @refugees, speak with an asylum seeker at a temporary reception center. 

Ingrid is spearheading the UN's efforts to support development in the country, which is still deeply scarred by ethnic divisions and the legacy of war and the 1995 Srebrenica genocide.

"We know that whenever you have these sorts of atrocity crimes that happened in Bosnia and Herzegovina, they're often preceded by hate. They're often preceded by individuals - political leaders, religious leaders, average people - putting out hate.”

Ingrid, who was raised in a small mining town in New Zealand, joined the #UnitedNations in 2016. From Darfur to the Philippines and from Peru to Ukraine, she has dedicated her life to working on behalf of people facing humanitarian, development and human rights challenges.

In the latest episode of our "Awake At Night" podcast, she talks about the obstacles she faced in many of those roles and her vivid memories of trying to advocate for the vulnerable, including her time helping women in Afghanistan.

Listen to her story by subscribing to Awake At Night wherever you get your podcast.

Regram: @melissarfleming | 📸: Ingrid Macdonald

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations in South Sudan. May be an image of 2 people, child and outdoors.

node.text:
Nyalang and her little sister were taken from their home in South Sudan in broad daylight. Abductions of women and children are commonplace in the African country, where girls are vulnerable to rape and sexual assault, while boys are recruited as soldiers.⁣
⁣
“After we were abducted, we walked for more than 14 days through the bushes," says Nyalang. "We barely had anything to eat or to drink. Once I asked for water for my little sister. I was beaten.”⁣
⁣
Thankfully, our colleagues from @unicef helped secure Nyalang’s release and reunite her with her family, although a year on, the two are still struggling to cope with the trauma they endured. ⁣
⁣
The #UnitedNations has verified at least 266,000 grave violations against children in conflict since 2005, including abductions, killings, recruitments as soldiers and rape.⁣
⁣
Join us in calling for children living in conflict to be protected. They are #NotATarget and perpetrators must be held to account.⁣
⁣
Regram: @unicef I 📷: © UNICEF/UN0475230

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 13, 2021. May be an image of indoor.

node.text:
Regram @antonioguterres: 

I have visited #Afghanistan many times over many years of conflict.

These trips were full of horror, misery and grief. But they were also marked by the hope, faith and determination of the Afghan people I met.

They want extreme poverty to be eradicated. They want decent jobs. They want their lives and basic freedoms to be protected. They want their country free of insecurity and terror.

They want what every one of us wants and deserves. We need to invest in that hope and promise.

I’m grateful for the generous contributions made in support of our humanitarian work in Afghanistan. I urge the international community to keep supporting these efforts and help protect the progress made over 20 years.

We can’t let down the people of Afghanistan.

Regram: @antonioguterres | 📷: UN Photo / Violaine Martin

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 13, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HONOUR THE PAST. SAFEGUARD THE FUTURE. PROTECT THE FACTS. We must #ProtectTheFacts #Protect'.

node.text:
When Holocaust distortion is left unchallenged, it can lead to Holocaust denial, antisemitism, conspiracy myths, hatred and dangerous forms of nationalism.

Knowing the history of Holocaust denial and distortion can help us better recognise when these tactics are being employed.

From learning about the Holocaust and engaging in constructive discussions to speaking up against distortion, we can all do our part to #ProtectTheFacts and remember the victims to safeguard our future.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 12, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, child and sitting.

node.text:
Johura and Bokkor, from #Bangladesh, eat lunch on their bed that was raised to prevent water damage.

Bangladesh is highly vulnerable to climate-related shocks and stresses, with the impacts of the climate crisis further exacerbate existing challenges. Last year, the country was struck by one of the most severe floods of the last few decades that affected 5.4 million people.

Just as floodwaters were rising and threatening their home, Johura and Bokkor received cash from the #UnitedNations Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF) to buy dry food to last them through the flooding.

The @worldfoodprogramme(WFP) works with partners to improve weather forecasting and flood data in Bangladesh, so people like Johura and Bokkor can prepare ahead of floodwaters and other weather disasters.⠀

Regram: un_ocha I 📷 WFP/Mehedi Rahman

#GlobalGoals #ClimateAction #ZeroHunger

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HUMANITY, not racism. #FIGHTracism'.

node.text:
Racism and xenophobia are the rejection of our common humanity. 
They tear holes in the social fabric that makes our communities strong. 
They hurt peace and justice which keep our communities safe.

#FightRacism to help build a world without discrimination and intolerance. 
#FightRacism to stand up for our common humanity.

Share in the comments what you are doing to spread tolerance and understanding!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 11, 2021. May be an image of 8 people, child and outdoors.

node.text:
Meet grandmother Lily who cares for her eight grandchildren in #Madagascar.

Severe food insecurity due to the impacts of the climate crisis continues to affect the southern part of the country, where people are living through the worst drought in 40 years and the resulting severe food shortages. 

To soothe their hunger, Lily and her grandchildren are forced to eat cactus, one of the only foods available to them.

Since the start of the lean season, the @worldfoodprogramme (WFP) has helped 750,000 people through food distribution activities aimed at preventing malnutrition.

Regram: @sharethemeal 

#ZeroHunger

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 11, 2021. May be an image of 8 people, child and outdoors.
Photo by United Nations on September 11, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, people standing and outdoors.
Photo by United Nations on September 11, 2021. May be a closeup of candle, fire and text.

node.text:
Regram @antonioguterres: 

As we mark 20 years of the heinous attacks of 9/11, my thoughts are with the victims, survivors & families.

The solidarity & resolve shown by the international community in those dark days should continue to inspire & guide our efforts to create a future without terrorism.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 10, 2021. May be an image of indoor.

node.text:
Regram @antonioguterres: 

We are at a pivotal moment.

The choices we make — or fail to make — today could result in further breakdown and a future of perpetual crises, or could lead to a better, peaceful future for our planet and all its people.

Humanity’s very future depends on solidarity, trust, and our ability to work together as a global family to achieve our shared goals.

Today I presented to UN member countries my vision for Our Common Agenda, my vision for a global effort to tackle the challenges we face and to chart a road ahead.

No community or country, however powerful, can solve our biggest challenges alone. We have to find a way to trust and care for one another again so we can move forward, together.

Regram: @antonioguterres | 📷: UN Photo / Eskinder Debebe

#GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'S KE URGENT CTION TO OMBAT IMATE GE AND IMPACT'.

node.text:
#FBF to September 2019, when @unep Goodwill Ambassador and SDG Advocate @diamirzaofficial dropped by our #UNGA VIP Social Media Studio to show her support for #ClimateAction.

"We need to stop looking at this enormously challenging reality that we have created for ourselves as a species, and running away from it, in the name of convenience or in the name of lethargy.”

"Yes, it is going to call for a huge and significant shift in the way we consume and the way we think, and the way we live. But it has to be done, and we can do it."

In the latest episode of our climate podcast "No Denying It", Dia Mirza and sustainable fashion advocate @aditimayer talk about the links between the fashion industry, the climate crisis and colonialism. Have a listen wherever you get your podcasts.

📷: Christophe Wu

#FlashbackFriday #GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 09, 2021. May be an image of text that says '400 40 Every seconds, someone dies by suicide World Health Organization'.

node.text:
Friday is World #SuicidePrevention Day.

Every 40 seconds, someone in the world ends their own life. Each death is a tragedy that affects families, communities and entire countries, and has long-lasting effects on those left behind.

For people with severe depression, it is not uncommon to think about suicide. Stigma, particularly surrounding mental disorders and suicide, means many people thinking of taking their own life are not seeking help, which means they are not getting the support they need.

Here are some warning signs that someone may be seriously thinking about suicide: 
➡️ Threatening to kill oneself.
➡️ Saying things like "No one will miss me when I am gone."
➡️ Looking for ways to kill oneself.
➡️ Saying good-bye to close family members and friends or giving away of valued possessions.

📷: @who 

#WorldSuicidePreventionDay

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations in Kabul, Afghanistan. May be an image of child and headscarf.

node.text:
13-year-old Lameah and her sister survived an armed attack targeting girls and their families outside a high school in Kabul, #Afghanistan last May. Many of their beloved friends and teachers did not survive - 85 people were killed and more than 200 others were injured.⁣
⁣
Every student and teacher should feel safe at school, yet for millions around the world, that is not a reality. More than 11,000 attacks against schools and universities were reported in the past five years alone.⁣
⁣
Attacks on schools, students and educators are attacks on children’s education and their future.⁣
⁣
On Thursday's International Day to Protect Education from Attack, our message is clear: Schools are #NotATarget.⁣
⁣
